body_html:
Up to me, we have Code duplication in the functions the functions: tf.zeros/ones and tf.zeros_like/ones.like.

More than just allowing a more generic behavior, I would think it is of good practice to have one single set of functions that maintains the core logic, the other ones would be some sort of proxies to maintain backward compatibility and numpy similarity.

It would be a lot more easy to maintain only one function that two. And in the execution or the user, it doesn't change anything.

body:
Up to me, we have Code duplication in the functions the functions: tf.zeros/ones and tf.zeros_like/ones.like.

More than just allowing a more generic behavior, I would think it is of good practice to have one single set of functions that maintains the core logic, the other ones would be some sort of proxies to maintain backward compatibility and numpy similarity.

It would be a lot more easy to maintain only one function that two. And in the execution or the user, it doesn't change anything.
